Hotgenes 0.0.25
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Makes expression plots via ggplot2

    ExpsPlot.Rd

    Makes expression plots via ggplot2

    ExpsPlot(
  Hotgenes = NULL,
  ExpressionSlots = NULL,
  SampleIDs = NULL,
  group = NULL,
  fill = NULL,
  color = NULL,
  xVar = NULL,
  yVar = NULL,
  linevar = NULL,
  boxplot = FALSE,
  pointplot = TRUE,
  basemean = FALSE,
  name_col = "Feature",
  value_col = "value",
  scales = "fixed",
  facets = NULL,
  filter_eval = NULL,
  named_levels = NULL,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    Hotgenes

    Hotgenes object.

    ExpressionSlots

    name of normalized data to use. If NULL (default), the first name returned by ExpressionSlots_ will be used. See HotgenesObj.

    SampleIDs

    vector of sample ids to select

    group

    String indicating the grouping variable.

    fill

    String variable to set fill, default is NULL.

    color

    String variable to set color, default is NULL.

    xVar

    String indicating the x variable. If NULL (default), the first column name reported by coldata_ function will be used.

    yVar

    String indicating the y variable

    linevar

    String variable to set line, default is NULL.

    boxplot

    logical default is FALSE. If TRUE a boxplot will be generated

    pointplot

    logical if TRUE (default), point will be generated.

    basemean

    Logical, if TRUE a horizontal line indicating the mean value for all samples will be shown. If FALSE (default) no line will be added

    name_col

    string for naming column with feature names, default is "Feature".

    value_col

    string for naming column with expression values, default is "value".

    scales

    Should scales be fixed ("fixed", the default), free ("free"), or free in one dimension ("free_x", "free_y")?

    facets

    A set of variables or expressions quoted by vars() and defining faceting groups on the rows or columns dimension. The variables can be named (the names are passed to labeller).

    For compatibility with the classic interface, can also be a formula or character vector. Use either a one sided formula, ~a + b, or a character vector, c("a", "b").

    filter_eval

    to be passed to filter.

    named_levels

    a named list containing the levels to set as reference via fct_relevel

    ...

    additional arguments for facet_wrap

    Value

    ggplot object

    Details

    xVar and group must be a column name accessible by coldata_ function. String for yVar must be accessible by parse_features() function.

    Examples

    # load packages
library(Hotgenes)
library(ggplot2)

dds_Hotgenes_dir <- system.file("extdata",
  paste0("dds_Hotgenes", ".RDS"),
  package = "Hotgenes",
  mustWork = TRUE
)
# from DESeq2
htgs <- readRDS(dds_Hotgenes_dir)

# ExpsPlot_Multi ----------------------------------------------------------

yvar <- c("CSF2", "CXCL8", "IL6")
xvar <- "Hrs"

# Multiple Features
M_Plot <- ExpsPlot(htgs,
  xVar = xvar,
  color = "Hrs",
  yVar = yvar,
  scales = "fixed"
)

M_Plot


M_Plot %>%
  ExpsPlot_Table(xVar = xvar)
#> # A tibble: 12 × 4
#>    yVar   Hrs0  Hrs2  Hrs6
#>    <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1 CSF2   4.62  4.89  5.20
#>  2 CSF2   4.66  4.84  5.04
#>  3 CSF2   4.70  5.33  5.89
#>  4 CSF2   4.80  5.12  5.71
#>  5 CXCL8  8.03 11.3  11.3 
#>  6 CXCL8  8.15 11.0  11.1 
#>  7 CXCL8  8.06 10.5  10.8 
#>  8 CXCL8  8.14 10.3  10.5 
#>  9 IL6    8.56 10.8  10.2 
#> 10 IL6    8.48 10.7  10.1 
#> 11 IL6    8.36 10.0   9.66
#> 12 IL6    8.26 10.0   9.58


# with auxiliary assays ----------------------------------------------------


htgs <- htgs %>% update_object()

# making example data
set.seed(12)

max_len <- length(SampleIDs_(htgs))

AssayData  <- auxiliary_assays_default(htgs)  %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(assay1 = rnorm(max_len),
                assay2 = rnorm(max_len))

auxiliary_assays_(htgs) <- AssayData
auxiliary_assays_(htgs)
#>                  assay1      assay2
#> shCON_0hrs_1 -1.4805676 -0.77956651
#> shCON_0hrs_2  1.5771695  0.01195176
#> shCON_2hrs_1 -0.9567445 -0.15241624
#> shCON_2hrs_2 -0.9200052 -0.70346425
#> shCON_6hrs_1 -1.9976421  1.18887916
#> shCON_6hrs_2 -0.2722960  0.34051227
#> shEWS_0hrs_1 -0.3153487  0.50696817
#> shEWS_0hrs_2 -0.6282552 -0.29330515
#> shEWS_2hrs_1 -0.1064639  0.22364142
#> shEWS_2hrs_2  0.4280148  2.00720146
#> shEWS_6hrs_1 -0.7777196  1.01197912
#> shEWS_6hrs_2 -1.2938823 -0.30245925

# add colors
ExpsPlot(htgs,
         xVar = "Hrs",
         color = "Hrs",
         yVar = c("CSF2", "ENSG00000169429", "assay2")
)


# add colors
ExpsPlot(htgs,
         xVar = "Hrs",
         color = "Hrs",
         yVar = c("CSF2", "CXCL8")
)


# add colors
ExpsPlot(htgs,
         xVar = "sh",
         color = "sh",
         yVar = c("CSF2", "CXCL8")
)


# add colors
ExpsPlot(htgs,
         xVar = "sh",
         color = "sh",
         yVar = c("assay2")
)



# ExpsPlot --------------------------------------------

# yvar<-"CSF2"
xvar <- "Hrs"

# add colors
ExpsPlot(htgs,
  xVar = xvar,
  color = "Hrs",
  yVar = yvar
)


# add lines
ExpsPlot(htgs,
  xVar = xvar,
  linevar = "Bio_Rep",
  yVar = yvar
)


# set new level factor level
ExpsPlot(htgs,
  xVar = "Hrs",
  color = "sh",
  named_levels = list(Hrs = c("6")),
  yVar = yvar
)


# set subset data
ExpsPlot(htgs,
  xVar = "Hrs",
  color = "sh",
  filter_eval = sh == "EWS",
  yVar = yvar
)


# add facets
facets <- c("sh")

htgs %>%
  coldata_(coldata_ids = facets)
#>                sh
#> shCON_0hrs_1 Ctrl
#> shCON_0hrs_2 Ctrl
#> shCON_2hrs_1 Ctrl
#> shCON_2hrs_2 Ctrl
#> shCON_6hrs_1 Ctrl
#> shCON_6hrs_2 Ctrl
#> shEWS_0hrs_1  EWS
#> shEWS_0hrs_2  EWS
#> shEWS_2hrs_1  EWS
#> shEWS_2hrs_2  EWS
#> shEWS_6hrs_1  EWS
#> shEWS_6hrs_2  EWS

P <- ExpsPlot(htgs,
  xVar = xvar,
  yVar = yvar,
  # color = "sh",
  facets = facets,
  scales = "free",
  nrow = 3, labeller = label_both
) +

  theme_classic(base_size = 11) +
  theme(aspect.ratio = 1 / 2)

P


# Reformat data for graphpad ----------------------------------------------

P %>%
  ExpsPlot_Table(xVar = xvar, facets = facets)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 7
#>   yVar  shCtrl_Hrs0 shCtrl_Hrs2 shCtrl_Hrs6 shEWS_Hrs0 shEWS_Hrs2 shEWS_Hrs6
#>   <chr>       <dbl>       <dbl>       <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 CSF2         4.62        4.89        5.20       4.70       5.33       5.89
#> 2 CSF2         4.66        4.84        5.04       4.80       5.12       5.71
#> 3 CXCL8        8.03       11.3        11.3        8.06      10.5       10.8 
#> 4 CXCL8        8.15       11.0        11.1        8.14      10.3       10.5 
#> 5 IL6          8.56       10.8        10.2        8.36      10.0        9.66
#> 6 IL6          8.48       10.7        10.1        8.26      10.0        9.58
